definition: kendō (sports)
double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: And I like to use Epee, Kendo , and Broadsword styles.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡使用重劍，劍道以及闊刀風格。

sentences.english: Don't give up chasing your goals. That is something that is unique to the art of Kendo.
sentences.chinese: 不要放棄自己的目標，這就是劍道與衆不同的地方。

sentences.english: In Canada, lot of people don't know that we are very strong in kendo.
sentences.chinese: 在加拿大，很多人都不知道，我們劍道非常強。

sentences.english: Coach of the Hong Kong Team of The 9 th World Kendo Championship.
sentences.chinese: 第九回世界劍道選手權大會香港隊教練。

sentences.english: Do you believe that a referee licensing system should be introduced in kendo?
sentences.chinese: 您覺得應該把裁判認證系統引入劍道中麼？

definition: military skill or technique (in former times)/all kinds of martial art sports (some claiming spiritual development)/self-defense/tradition of choreographed fights from opera and film (recent usage)/also called kungfu 功夫/CL:種|种[zhong3]
to stop/to obstruct
to learn/to acquire (some skill through practice)/acquisition
power/might
shadowboxing or Taiji, T'aichi or T'aichichuan/traditional form of physical exercise or relaxation/a martial art
valiant
fencing (sport)
to shoot/to fire (a gun)
Fuxing district of Handan city 邯鄲市|邯郸市[Han2 dan1 shi4], Hebei/Fuxing or Fuhsing township in Taoyuan county 桃園縣|桃园县[Tao2 yuan2 xian4], north Taiwan
to revive/to rejuvenate
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
main part/torso/the thing in itself/noumenon (object of purely intellectual perception according to Kant)
to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)
younger generation
to fight, esp. with hands/wrestling (as a sport)/to wrestle/to wrestle (against fate, with a problem etc)/to capture prey
to speak frankly with assurance
victor/winner
